title: Calories in Ribs
meta_description: Learn calories in ribs per 100g, with protein, fat, carbs, sodium details, quick tweaks, and FAQ answers for pork spare ribs.
assumptions: Pork spare ribs, bone-in, cooked (braised or roasted), separable lean and fat, no added sauce or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut (pork vs. beef), cooking method, fat trimming, and added sauces; check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked pork ribs contains about 277 kcal and 24g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Beef short ribs instead of pork

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of ribs?
faqs.a: Approximately 277 kcal for cooked pork spare ribs.
Yes, 100g provides about 24g protein, great for muscle support.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in ribs?
faqs.a: Around 20g total fat per 100g, including 7g saturated fat.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked ribs.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in ribs?
faqs.a: Braising or roasting is similar; frying or saucing adds 50-100+ kcal per 100g.
